wolfgang.title: Wolfgang
paras: Part of a seven-person team which competed at BC Game Jam 2020 constructing a 2d, top-down roguelike in Unity. Took on project manager role, running meetings, doing code review, spearheading design and managing the repository and the Kanban board. Also contributed menu UI, graphic design and algorithmic programming.

Wolfgang is a top-down roguelike action game built with the theming constraints of 'Pack' and 'Overcome.' It is built in Unity 2d with C#. In our development schema, to account for the extremely limited time frame, we used an agile system based around a Kanban board for tasks, and strictly enforced feature branching to ensure the project remained stable and clean.

lite.title: LITE
paras: Individually built an autoformatting tool using Python with Qt and XSLT which allows researchers and students to copy interlinear language data from SIL’s Fieldworks Language Explorer directly into academic papers. Worked closely with Prof. Larry Hayashi of the Canada Institute of Linguistics, who took on an owner role, to construct a cross platform desktop application based on his mockups.
This project was created over the course of a semester as part of a directed study on language software development.

clarifeye.title: ClarifEye
paras: Part of a four-person team which competed at nwHacks 2020.  Built and designed an Andoid application to aid the visually impaired by verbally identifying their surroundings as well as reading aloud text on objects or documents. Contributed knowledge of version control, team management, and graphic design, as well as designing and programming the core of our language synthesis algorithm.

ClarifEye utilizes the power of Google's Cloud Vision API to analyze the current image from the user's camera and synthesizes an audio description of that image through our original algorithm. Additionally, the application provides a text/document reading service to its users using similar computer vision technology. ClarifEye also places emphasis on audio and haptic cues to aid the user as they interact with the app through extremely simple swiping or tapping gestures.

samdelaney_tech.title: My Portfolio
paras: Individually designed and built this web-based portfolio website using ReactJS with Microsoft's Office UI Fabric components. It is a static site hosted on Github Sites (previously on Google Cloud Platform), but does allow users to send messages to me using EmailJS.

Samdelaney.tech is designed to be extensible to allow for future projects such as a personal blog and an application hosting site. It currently supports dynamic theming and is designed for easy conversion to a mobile site.

fieldworks.title: FieldWorks
paras: Summer Linguistic Software Developer at SIL International. Part of a team working with an agile Kanban organizational system. Designed and implemented discourse and syntactic analysis features of SIL’s FieldWorks Language Explorer, debugged the FieldWorks developer version installer, and performed code review using Gerrit.

FieldWorks is a suite of software tools that help researchers manage linguistic and cultural data. FieldWorks supports tasks ranging from the initial entry of collected data through to the preparation of data for publication, including dictionary development, interlinearization of texts, morphological analysis, and other publications. Furthermore, FieldWorks BTE contains a specialized drafting and editing environment for Bible Translators, which provides interaction with the language data stored in Language Explorer.

thecombine.title: The Combine
paras: Project Manager at SIL International – worked closely with a UX designer, owner and several consultants to design a web-based rapid word collection tool, accounting for users with limited written literacy, computer literacy, or technology. Continued managing, instructing and working with a team of 6 interns to build it within 3 months. Ran numerous user tests with clients to minimize the app's learning curve.

The Combine was built using Typescript with React/Redux, MaterialUI and Jest, as well as a C# based REST API connected to a Mongo database and tested through NUnit. It uses Redux for robust internationalization, and has been localized for several different common glossing languages. TheCombine also works on a variety of browsers and devices without formatting issues.

paratext.title: Paratext
paras: 'Software Developer - Paratext' at SIL International - one of 6 full time developers on Paratext: the world’s leading software application for translation, checking, and revision of the Bible from the original text into the languages of the world.

One of SIL's flagship applications, Paratext supplies textual translators with a multitude of powerful tools, including custom version control, live collaboration, AI-aided auto-translation, cross reference management, interlinearization, and much more.

As a full-stack developer on a small team, my duties range from developing UI components, to optimizing client-side algorithms, to handling data storage, and even to communicating directly with users. Writing unit tests, reviewing code, and reporting new issues all make their way into my daily tasks as part of our agile development process.

grabbit.title: Grabbit
paras: As the primary Smart Contract Developer at Grabbit, my duties varied widely. I worked on the specification and development of the onchain protocol and its offchain library, the integration of front and back-end services with the protocol, and designing & implementing the user interface to represent the protocol accurately and clearly.

My duties also included managing contracted engineering firms, identifying and securing partnerships throughout the community, & watching for & updating the company on relevant news. While at Grabbit I identified an insufficient blockchain standard, authored a new standard, and secured ratification and additional funding for the development of that standard.

pwmb.title: Pacific West Music of the Blind
paras: As the Solutions Architect for PWMOTB, I am responsible for all engineering of the site and user database used by PWMOTB for registering users, tracking donations, distributing media, and coordinating events & lessons.

Given the limited amount of time I could commit to the project as a volunteer I chose to build the site with accessibility to less technical volunteers in mind. The front end is designed and hosted through Webflow, using API calls to a Supabase database for a minimal backend.

reflex.title: Reflex
paras: Post-graduation I decided to continue my work on a project I had started as a directed study. Reflex was the result: an app which allowed authors to copy interlinear texts directly out of FieldWorks and used XSLT to convert the result into cleanly formatted HTML.
My experience with React and Typescript allowed me to create a much more presentable and accessible version of the product by publishing the web interface to Github pages with Github actions.
